summary: The Kessel Run was a hyperspace route within the Akkadese Maelstrom used by smugglers and unscrupulous freighter captains to...
caption: The Kessel Run was a hyperspace route within the Akkadese Maelstrom used by smugglers and unscrupulous freighter captains to move spice from the spice mines of Kessel at the behest of the Pyke Syndicate, who relied on the foolhardy Kessel Runs to deliver the illicit substance to their customers

blog.name: siennarossi
blog.title: He does something to me, that boy
blog.description: Nicole. 30. 🇵🇭. Serial bleeding-heart haver. Writes fics sometimes. Compiles playlists.

summary: Leia opened her moth to protest, but what was the point? “It’s like—like everything else is this raging storm, and he's… the...
text:
Leia opened her moth to protest, but what was the point? “It’s like—like everything else is this raging storm, and he's… the only safe place. The only one who lets me just be myself.”

“Beware words like ‘only,’” Amilyn said, wagging one long finger, but she was smiling. “Don’t let your head be turned by the most dangerous substance known to exist.”

“Which is?”

“A pair of pretty dark eyes.”
source: Star Wars: Leia, Princess of Alderaan, Claudia Gray

reblog.comment: Star Wars: Leia, Princess of Alderaan, Claudia Gray

blog.name: siennarossi
blog.title: He does something to me, that boy
blog.description: Nicole. 30. 🇵🇭. Serial bleeding-heart haver. Writes fics sometimes. Compiles playlists.

summary:
Can it be morally right to feel happy when there’s so much injustice all around us?” 

“Of course. Happiness is our moral...
text:
Can it be morally right to feel happy when there’s so much injustice all around us?”

“Of course. Happiness is our moral imperative.”

“That sounds"—Leia actually got into the backbend, but felt like her abdominal muscles were pressing the breath from her—"like—like hedonism.”

“Not at all.” Lifting herself upright again with damnable ease, Amilyn said, “Great evil can only be fought by the strong. People need spiritual fuel as much as they need food, water, and air. Happiness, love, joy, hope—these are the emotions that give us the strength to do what we need to do.
source: Star Wars: Leia, Princess of Alderaan, Claudia Gray

reblog.comment: Star Wars: Leia, Princess of Alderaan, Claudia Gray

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

blog.description:
Mostly Star Wars, Game of Thrones, The Musketeers and impure thoughts about Adam Driver. 
Now with added Infinity War.

summary: Potential Star Wars couples as parents
title: Potential Star Wars couples as parents
body:
Let’s face it, there has not been a lot of good parenting on display in the Star Wars universe, with the honourable exception of Anakin’s mother; Darth Vader’s last minute saving of Luke does not quite make up for the many previous years of neglect / attempted murder. Leaving out Han and Leia, who clearly love their son even if they made a few mistakes raising him, let’s look at some of the current Star Wars ships to see how they might fare if they ever started a family together.

This will be done in A03 ship order, and includes only surviving characters.


1. Kylo and Hux

Quite clearly, these two would make terrible parents. Bitter, argumentative, violent, not to mention morally shaky, these two would constantly play their child off against each other in a psychological battle that would tear the poor squirt apart. Best they just get a cat. Even then, it better watch out. 1/10.


2. Rey and Kylo

Hmmm. It’s fair to say that these two have some issues that they should probably work through before they rush into having a kid. If (and it’s a big if) Kylo could work through his anger issues, they could find some common ground politically and stop arguing all the time, they just might manage to bring up a child without horribly scarring them (mentally or physically). The kid would probably have incredibly strong force powers, which would be an extra challenge. Star Wars history suggests this would not end well. 4/10.


3. Finn and Poe

Obviously Finn and Poe would be terrific parents. Funny, affectionate, cool - wouldn’t you want to be brought up by these two? Orphan Finn would clearly be desperate to give a child the safe, loving childhood he never had. Sure, Poe can be a bit reckless, but hopefully having kids would calm him down and encourage him to take fewer risks. Bet he cooks a great roast too. 9/10.


4. Finn and Rey

Again, these two would make a very good parenting pair; strong, in tune, loyal and tireless. Two orphans who really know the importance of a loving home and family, there is nothing these two would not do for their lucky kid. Both a little young, perhaps, but what they lack in experience they would make up for in energy. 9/10.


5. Poe and Kylo

Like Reylo, Poe and Kylo would probably have to do a bit of work on themselves as a couple before starting a family. They are on opposite sides in the war, with entirely different views on everything, and it is difficult to see how they would agree on important child-raising stuff such as setting boundaries, encouraging creativity and should-our-child-be-good-or-evil. Kid would be a great pilot though. 2/10


6. Poe and Rey

Not a bad shout - Poe and Rey are on the same side, and have quite a bit in common. We haven’t really seen enough of Poe and Rey together to see what their dynamic would be, but my hunch is that they are both too hot-headed, that they would start to annoy each other and that bickering and eye-rolling would rapidly come to dominate their relationship, before Poe’s not-so-secret love for Finn came out and it all ended in tears. 6/10.


7. Finn and Rose

I like Rose (so there) and she would clearly be a terrific mum, able to teach her kids kindness, empathy, wisdom, and how to fix anything. Finn would be a great, fun, loving dad who would always be home in time for the bedtime story. They make a great team. Can’t see any problems really. 10/10.


8. Hux and Poe

This could work. No, hear me out. I know Hux is evil, but perhaps under that icy veneer lurks a lonely soul who just needs someone to reach out to him - someone like the dashing resistance pilot - to melt his frozen heart, turn his life around and become a loving husband and father. Too much of a stretch you say? Yeah you’re probably right. 3/10.

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

summary: What happens next in Little Broken Ben? Does Ben finally have to answer everyone’s questions? Or does he get too overwhelmed by...
question: What happens next in Little Broken Ben? Does Ben finally have to answer everyone’s questions? Or does he get too overwhelmed by being back in the Temple, feeling all of the Jedi alive again. And maybe Qui-Gon is the only one who can help him calm down.
answer:
Smiling slightly with relief as he watched Ben glaze up at the ceiling with fever dulled but open eyes, Qui-Gon shifted forward only to freeze when the Force went shrill with warning, simultaneously as Ben’s eyes went wide and his body spasmed as if hit by electricity.

The smell of ozone filled the medical room and pure light started to flicker along Ben’s skin as he dug his hands into into the sheets wrapped around him, his legs flailing and lashing out hard enough to hit the padawan healer in the stomach when he rushed to try and hold Ben down.

“Kark!” Qui-Gon swore, feeling Ben’s fear and shock fill the Force.

No not just fear but terror, mind numbing and paralyzing.

“No,” Ben gasped out, breaking most of the frozen Jedi from their surprise and Qui-Gon jumped forward, grasping Ben’s shoulder to try and keep the other still. “No!” Ben screamed out, jerking, sweat clinging to his white as death skin as he struggled against Qui-Gon’s hold.

“Ben! Its alright, you’re safe!” Qui-Gon rasped out, growling in pain as the light burned his hands but he didn’t let loose his grip, seeing from the corner of his eyes that the healers were preparing a hypospray and Qui-Gon hoped it was a sedative of some sort.

“C-Can’t! Can’t again!” Ben gasped, shaking as tears started running down his cheeks, eyes wide at Qui-Gon. “To many bodies! Qui-Gon don’t make me! Not again! Not the temple!” He screamed only to jerk to when the hypospray was set, eyes wide before slowly closing.

“…Its okay Ben… just relax.” Qui-Gon murmured, his voice shaking as he absorbed the words and Ben started to slip under, his racing breath and heart becoming calmer.

“What the kark ju-” Mace swore only to swear even louder as to Qui-Gon’s horror, Ben’s peeping heart monitor became one monotonous tone with the redhead falling utterly still.

“MOVE!” Master Zukada roared, forcibly shoving everyone from the bed with the Force as he stepped forward and set his hands to Ben’s chest where he ripped the tunic open and set his hands to the bared pale chest, the smell of ozone once more filling the air as Ben’s body jerked with the Force being shoved through him, Zukada’s lekkus being burned with how close he was leaning in.

Qui-Gon, sitting on the floor from when he had been shoved aside by the healer, watched with his breath caught in his chest for what felt like forever as Master Zukada gave a loud growling roar and then Ben’s body jerked once more and the pulsing of the heart monitor once more filled the air.

Zukada pulled back slowly, stumbling only for one of the other healers to catch him and help him to a seat, Obi-Wan helping a shaking Qui-Gon up who was ignoring his burned hands as he stared at Ben with dismay. “…What just…”

“Too much it got,” Yaddle spoke up, frowning slightly as her ears twitched. “To much Force, to much emotions and memory. Short circuited his own heart and body he did with it.” Her frown grew, the implication of so much trauma and Force clearly troubling as Qui-Gon slowly moved forward to touch Ben.

Already there hand prints were appearing red on Ben’s pale chest, the sight of the few chest hairs Ben had burned by the Force power at play to get his heart restarted.

But he was breathing still.

‘Bodies… he spoke of bodies and the temple… Ben what did you see? What have you been through? What happened in the future?’ Qui-Gon wondered as he stroked the others hair away from pale sweaty skin with damaged fingers, Obi-Wan at his elbow before his padawan carefully caught his master’s sleeve.

Turning his attention on the younger man, Qui-Gon raised his brow. “There’s not much we can do right now but let the healers work master,” Obi-Wan said seriously, staring up at him before looking down at Qui-Gon’s hands. “But we can deal with those, Ben won’t be happy to know he hurt you if you leave it be.” He said with conviction.

Glancing down at Ben before nodding, Obi-Wan was right. If Qui-Gon left the injuries to fester, Ben would feel guilt. “Alright, lets get these coated in bacta.” He agreed quietly, snorting when an eager apprentice healer instantly bounced forward.

The young were always eager.

summary: Inkkas lança coleção de tênis do Star Wars
title: Inkkas lança coleção de tênis do Star Wars
body:
Inkkas lança coleção de tênis do Star Wars

A empresa de calçados Inkkas lançou uma coleção de tênis do Star Wars, que incluem também sapatos e botas inspiradas na série criada por George Lucas e atualmente é propriedade da Disney.

Cada calçado tem um estilo diferente e se refere a diversos personagens ou referências da série, como um sapato inspirado no Chewbacca, um tênis na Estrela da Morte ou do R2D2.

São modelos para homens e…

View On WordPress
